name: Chick Corea
description:
'''Armando Anthony''' "'''Chick'''" '''Corea''' (June 12, 1941 â€“ February 9, 2021) was an American [[jazz]] pianist, composer, bandleader and occasional percussionist. His compositions "[[Spain (instrumental)|Spain]]", "[[500 Miles High]]", "La Fiesta", "Armando's Rhumba" and "[[Windows (composition)|Windows]]" are considered [[jazz standard]]s. As a member of [[Miles Davis]]'s band in the late 1960s, he participated in the birth of [[jazz fusion]]. In the 1970s he formed [[Return to Forever]]. Along with [[McCoy Tyner]], [[Herbie Hancock]] and [[Keith Jarrett]], Corea is considered one of the foremost pianists of the post-[[John Coltrane]] era.

Corea continued to collaborate frequently while exploring different musical styles throughout the 1980s and 1990s. He won 28 [[Grammy Awards]] and was nominated for the award 72 times.
